22617.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4f0fh","text":"Wash hermaphrodites off plate with several ml of M9 solution and transfer to 15ml falcon tube (Fisher Scientific-Falcon 352096)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6gje6","text":"Fill falcon tube up to 15ml with M9 solution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eodli","text":"Centrifuge for 2 minutes at 1500 rpm (RCF:210, ascending 9; descending 7) – program 1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"408q1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"edr02","text":"Program 1 retains the worms as pellets and the bacteria is suspended as the supernatant","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"beln7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5ua7c","text":"The descending is slow as the worm pellet is lose at this stage which we don't want to break","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"brvgo","text":"Remove supernatant using a plastic Pasteur pipette taking care not to disturb pellet","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8f130","text":"Leave atleast 0.5ml M9 to avoid disturbing the pellet","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"36rit","text":"Fill the tube with M9 upto 15ml","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4h9b5","text":"Spin program 1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3k1sq","text":"Repeat steps 4-6 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8jndd","text":"On final wash remove as much supernatant as possible and add M9 upto 4ml","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a8ln5","text":"Add 4ml 2X Bleach solution  (From here onwards try to work as quickly as possible to avoid over-exposure of the worms  to the bleach)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d6pj9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bokll","text":"USE FRESHLY PREPARED BLEACH EVERYTIME","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":37}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1lk6t","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":19,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"a90u5","text":"2X Bleach solution:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cssea","text":" ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3j2c7","text":"5% Sodium hypochlorite solution - 4ml","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2qb43","text":"Sterile water - 3.5 ml","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bkrpr","text":"1M NaOH solution - 2.5 ml","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1ites","text":"TOTAL - 10 ml","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"62r2v","text":"Vortex on maximum setting for 4 min (no more as this will damage the eggs) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6qu9k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8a6od","text":"Makesure the vortex forms ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"61r7h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"etoc6","text":"After vortexing, top up the tube with M9 till 15ml","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cahme","text":"Centrifuge for 2 mins at 2500rpm (RCF:590, ascending 9; descending 7) – program 2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cj03q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"70c74","text":"(Always check the program on the centrifuge before using it)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7khv7","text":"Remove supernatant by pouring into waste bottle – pellet should be compact and yellow in colour at bottom of falcon, but be careful not to lose","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bm3b6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f2u92","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"65rd8","text":"Add 15ml M9","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"48ltj","text":"Centrifuge at program 2","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e2rd9","text":"Repeat steps 12-14 four more times","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e54tp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"46ji2","text":"The number of washes is crucial here as we need to get rid of all the bleach","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9mqmn","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dgjjt","text":"After final wash add 15ml M9 and store eggs/larvae in the falcon on the rotator that is constantly spinning at 20oC, until feeding  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":113,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"43o4r","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4i5o4","text":"L1 arrested larvae can be starved for up to 5 days before refeeding","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7p1in","text":"Centrifuge larvae on program 2 to pellet","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"gjoo","text":"Remove supernatant with plastic Pasteur pipette","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1h9rc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a1qu2","text":"The pellet is lose here so makesure not to disturb it","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7nji7","text":"Add 15ml M9, spin to wash","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"75gje","text":"On final wash leave 0.5ml M9 in falcon","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2qb4g","text":"Resuspend the pellet by gently tapping the tube/flicking it","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cirps","text":"Place droplet containing larvae onto seeded plate and allow to grow to desired developmental state (ie. 2 days for L4s, 2.5 days for young adults)  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ahtqn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5ngug","text":"Use glass pipette to place the droplet onto seeded plate, avoid using plastic pipette as larvae will stick to it","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c4i0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":26,"offset":0,"style":"bold"},{"length":1,"offset":23,"style":"sup"}],"key":"eeje2","text":"Development times at 20oC:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5635n","text":"2 days for L4s","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8rb0a","text":"2.5 days for young adults","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7na1f","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":5,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"3fk7b","text":"Note:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7j89b","text":"If you feed larvae within 12hrs of bleaching then they develop faster than the longer arrested ones","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8cj7e","text":"It is a good practice to bleach in two tubes in parallel","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"v906","text":"If you drop the tube at any point of the process, makesure to transfer the contents into a new tube as the dropped tube may get cracked resulting in loss of worms during centrifugation/vortexing","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cidrp","text":"Any unused larvae can be topped up with M9 and stored spinning in the rotator to be re-used","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4lm6t","text":"Use clean autoclaved rubber bulbs for the refeeding everytime to avoid contamination","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4pjhd","text":"Put the used bulb in the box labelled 'Used Teets'","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fllvt","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":4}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fl7ci","text":"      ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8plbv","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6r9a4","text":" ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"eckvc","text":" ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cnhj6","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2u5s4","text":" ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3asat","text":" ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dpaol","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5cdom","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dsha","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"B20EE3A0B2D111E9BF1251578DC8BC39","height":263,"id":213162,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bbbch","text":"Table of Development times for different temperatures","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/dc523npn.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gsfk3npn.jpg","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gsfj3npn.webp","width":464},"mutability":"","type":"image"}}}}}}

24312.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2blhe","text":"Sterilize the hood with Ethanol","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"84gol","text":"Count the number of plates to be poured and stack them inside the hood (A stack of 10 or 5 depending on convenience)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a74mi","text":" Volumes to be poured for different sized plates are:        ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4pvvf","text":"            Large plates 90mm: 45 mL – possible with 8mm tubing ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bri91","text":"            Medium plates 60mm: 15 mL – possible with 8mm tubing","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5u8v7","text":"            Small plates 35mm: 3.5 mL – possible with 3mm tubing","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fp69n","text":"Set the flow rate to 2 in the hood ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2ukg5","text":" Turn on the lights and Plug switches","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ca5v","text":" Take the Pump and plug it in","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3n4ip","text":" Set up the pump for the desired parameters:\na) Setup -\u003e Options -\u003eNext -\u003e Volume (15ml for medium plates) -\u003e Accept\nb) Setup -\u003e Options -\u003e Next -\u003e Tube -\u003e 8mm (Usually 8mm for big and medium plates and 3mm for imaging plates)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5isko","text":"      c) Setup -\u003e Options -\u003e Next -\u003e Direction (Clockwise is preferred)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3k490","text":"      d) Setup -\u003e Options -\u003e Next -\u003e Profile (This is the mode of the flow and preferrably set to Slow-Slow-Slow)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bhaek","text":" Place the tubing around the pump making sure both ends are inserted into the agar bottle (Make sure the tubing is placed clockwise as the pump moves that way)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"45f2h","text":" Prime the tubes by: Setup-\u003e Prime -\u003e Accept (Leave it on for few mins till the tubes get warm), Press Accept to stop Prime. Priming is very important to make the tubes warm and to avoid the agar being solidified.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7qk4q","text":"Be careful not to touch the ends of the tube.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8ovo8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8s1d8","text":" Place the nozzle perpendicluarly on top of the centre of the plate and press the foot pedal letting the agar to flow","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"74qb1","text":" If some agar spills on the surface wipe it off with a paper towel after it solidifies","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b8qlp","text":" When taking a pause of more than 1min put the pump back to prime","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"aqvin","text":" When one bottle finishes, place the nozzle in the new bottle and prime to suck out the residual agar into the next bottle to prevent wastage (Wash the empty bottle and get some hot water in it)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9j6il","text":" Put both openings into the new bottle and prime again","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3pk35","text":"When you reach the end of the second/last bottle stop pouring and discard the residual agar in the waste bucket","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2958j","text":" After pouring, wash the tubing (Prime) by passing  hot water from the clean bottle to the other one (to remove any agar in the tube)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3jp1r","text":" Followed by priming air into the tubing making sure no liquid is remaining","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4nk54","text":" Discard any agar in the waste bucket, wash the bottles and put them in the grey box in the lab","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9ok2k","text":" Close all switches in the hood","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4sn5u","text":" Return the pump","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9lt96","text":"Clean the hood for the next user","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b37es","text":" Wrap and label the tube 2x in aluminium foil, label it with tube size and lab room number (eg 8mm Tubing R5020) and take it to the media kitchen to put in the autoclave basket (Collect the tube the following day)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"730la","text":" Order agar in the media kitchen for the next pouring day (i.e. Every other Monday)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9a1u","text":" Let the plates solidify under the hood about an hour, label them with the date poured and then store them in the cold room upside down","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f0m24","text":"On the same day of the pouring, measure the weights of 3 random poured plates with lids on from the stack and add to the plate weight data file in the shared folder","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ejemv","text":"The pharynx is a is a neuromuscular pump found at the anterior end of the alimentary tract, consisting of 20 muscles and 20 neurons. A proper feeding rate in worms is coordinated by the precise timing of pharyngeal movements, with one complete cycle of synchronous contraction and relaxation of the corpus and terminal bulb termed a “pump”. A simple way to measure C. elegans feeding is to count how many times worms pump in a minute (pumps per minute). Movement of the grinder (in the terminal bulb) can easily be observed using a stereomicroscope, and because cycles of contraction/relaxation are synchronised along the pharynx, pumps per minute can be measured simply by counting grinder movements.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":365,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"78ms8","text":"Consumables per worm strain:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5oadb","text":"4 x 90 mm petri dish","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9j2c6","text":"5 x 60 mm petri dish","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ujt8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fmvgj","text":"Reagents for bleaching:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"75h1b","text":"Sodium hypochlorite, 5% Chlorine (Fisher Scientific, Catalog status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7tdbh","text":"Using an eyelash pick, pick 10 x L4s of each worm strain to be assayed onto 2 x 90 mm plates (pre-seeded with OP50) and incubate at  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":132,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"684g6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"56900AF06E1211EC8EEDCFB2CE61CA99","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"20","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ck3au","text":"Prepare and pour the following number of NGM plates per worm strain to be studied:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1vtor","text":"5 x 60 mm (  agar per plate)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":11,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"77ufe","text":"2 x 90 mm (  agar per plate)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":11,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ck861","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cf3u4","text":"Therefore make  NGM per strain ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":9,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":15,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eln3u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"46f1h","text":"To ensure accuracy when weighing out media components it is recommended that you do not prepare agar in volumes less than 250 mL at a time! ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":140}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7bv1r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"15","error":false,"guid":"591FC5706E3111EC8EEDCFB2CE61CA99","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"35","error":false,"guid":"74D4D1C06E3111EC8EEDCFB2CE61CA99","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"150","error":false,"guid":"341FE0C06E3111EC8EEDCFB2CE61CA99","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bsjn3","text":"Prepare NGM agar and autoclave","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"us9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b0hek","text":"Protocol for preparing NGM: dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bvh7n39n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":28,"length":41}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"847ED1566E0F11EC9E0B0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bvh7n39n"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"99o9e","text":"In the laminar flow hood, pour 5 x 60 mm and 2 x 90 mm plates per worm strain","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cgdnq","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4hlat","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"","data":{"id":24312,"title":"Plate Pouring","title_html":"Plate Pouring","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"plate-pouring-3yygpxw","image":{"source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Priota Islam","affiliation":"Imperial College London","affiliation_url":"http://behave.lms.mrc.ac.uk/","username":"priota-islam","link":"https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Priota_Islam","image":{"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/86b3npn.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/86b3npn.jpg","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":3},"type_id":1,"guid":"66891F306E0F11EC8EEDCFB2CE61CA99"}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"bivfg","text":"Refeed bleach synchronised L1s","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5du3r","text":"Dry 2 x 90 mm plates per worm strain in the cabinet dryer (setting 2) for 1.5 hours","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4b170","text":"At 16:50, spin L1s bleached in step 4 using centrifuge program 1 (2500 rpm, 2 mins)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5b473","text":"Once plates have dried, store agar-side up in an airtight container in the cold room","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"blb8o","text":"Seed the 90 mm plates with OP50 and leave to dry overnight at room temperature","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"90mk1","text":"Bleach synchronise worms (picked in Step 1) and store eggs/larvae in a 15 mL falcon tube on the rotator that is constantly spinning at   until feeding  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":135,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4bk8p","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dtnno","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fasr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"B73B76F06E1C11EC8EEDCFB2CE61CA99","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"20","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"","data":{"id":22617,"title":"Bleach synchronisation of C. elegans","title_html":"Bleach synchronisation of C. elegans","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"bleach-synchronisation-of-c-elegans-2bzgap6","image":{"source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/default_protocol.png","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Ida Barlow","affiliation":null,"affiliation_url":null,"username":"ida-barlow","link":null,"image":{"source":"/img/avatars/011.png","placeholder":"/img/avatars/011.png","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":22},"type_id":1,"guid":"BB6F84B06E1111EC8EEDCFB2CE61CA99"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6q5kl","text":"Using a plastic pipette remove the supernatent, taking care to not disturb the worm pellet, and leave ~1 mL of M9 in the tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"eb3ku","text":"Gently flick the falcon tube to resuspend the L1s","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"am7ef","text":"Using a glass pipette, drop 1 small droplet around the edges (off food) of the pre-seeded 90 mm plates (prepared in Step 3)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"brc5q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"582g6","text":"It is recommended that you check the density of worms in the droplet down a microscope and add another if necessary","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":115}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4r9t3","text":"Place plates agar-side down in the    incubator to allow droplets to dry (~5-10 mins), then invert plates and allow to grow for 2.5 days","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":35,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1ne6l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"4DCDD8A06E1411EC8EEDCFB2CE61CA99","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"20","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b51bv","text":"In the morning, take the 60 mm plates from the cold room, and weigh three random plates without their lids","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"33mob","text":"Dry plates in in cabinet dryer (setting 2) with lids off until they have lost 3-5% of their weight (approx 2 hours)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"91r05","text":"Aseptically prepare 1:10 dilution of OP50 in M9 in a 15 mL falcon tube:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b7ift","text":"   OP50","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fb3vs","text":"   M9","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"epel","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"5A6FFCE06E1511EC8EEDCFB2CE61CA99","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"9","error":false,"guid":"632C29D06E1511EC8EEDCFB2CE61CA99","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"39n1j","text":"Working by a flame, dispense   of the dilute OP50 into the centre of each 60 mm plate and allow droplets to dry at room temp","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":29,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"24bar","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3qmfd","text":"Ensure that you do not touch the agar with the pipette tip and that plates are kept on a flat surface so you get a nice, even circle of food once dried","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":151}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6bsu8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"30","error":false,"guid":"7C7B0B906E1511EC8EEDCFB2CE61CA99","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e4m59","text":"Once the food has dried, leave plates agar-side up at room temp overnight","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"667a0","text":"Label 5 x 60 mm plates seeded with   OP50 (around the edge, so not to obscure the bacterial lawn) per worm strain ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":35,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"960f4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"30","error":false,"guid":"FBC4DDA06E1E11EC8EEDCFB2CE61CA99","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dvho3","text":"At 09:00, use an eyelash-pick to transfer 10 x young adult worms (prepared in Step 5) onto the edge of each 60 mm plate (away from food)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9kvih","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3pr1i","text":"This yields a total of 50 worms per strain","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":42}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"27i8g","text":"Incubate plates, agar-side up, at   for 1 hour","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":34,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fhde6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"faui9","text":"This allows worms to crawl to the bacterial lawn and start foraging again","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":73}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"9F2889E06E1711EC8EEDCFB2CE61CA99","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"20","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7t30","text":"Working one plate at a time, place a 60 mm plate upon a dissecting stereo microscope at the highest magnification possible and bring the worms/bacterial lawn to focus","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dkm73","text":"Working on a single worm at a time, identify the grinder (in the terminal bulb of the head) of each worm and ensure this is clearly in focus","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e2hml","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dv2ni","text":"See: http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_measurepharyngeal/measurepharyngeal.html for detailed images/diagrams of pharynx and terminal bulb","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":5,"length":77}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"7DD21C256E1911EC9E0B0A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://www.wormbook.org/chapters/www_measurepharyngeal/measurepharyngeal.html"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7fes7","text":"Use a tally counter to count the grinder movements of a worm over a 20 second period ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9hl4c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2j2nr","text":"Repeat this 3 times per worm and record the result as an average of the three counts","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":84}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ae5cn","text":"Go clockwise around the bacterial lawn, and repeat the steps above for each worm on the 60 mm plate. Then repeat for each 60 mm plate remaining in the incubator","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7m8a6","text":"Calculate pharyngeal pumps per minute of each strain:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ditko","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ut1u","text":"pumps per minute = pumps per 20 seconds * 3","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Pharyngeal Pumping Assay
